results.title: [PDF] BIO BOOK | 20 10 – 20 11 - Harvard Business School
results.content: Policy/ Government Education: Harvard College, Cambridge, MA, AB Health Care Policy, 2005; Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, MD, 2011 Work Experience: Healthcare Management Intern, Department of Surgery, Brigham and Women’s Hospital; Harvard Medical School Student; Consultant to Chair in Health Management Strategies on development of Leadership Program, University of Toronto Faculty of Medicine. Biography: Independent biomedical research in the laboratory of Robert Langer at MIT; technical and diligence consulting experience with several seed-stage life science startups; two years academic business development experience as licensing associate at Mount Sinai Medical Center in NYC; Entrepreneurial Fellow at Flagship Ventures during summer 2010 Extracurriculars: Member of Entrepreneurship Club, Healthcare Club Raj Singh RC rsingh@mba2012.hbs.edu Healthcare Interests: Biotech. Education: Harvard University, Cambridge, MA, BA Chemistry, 2006 Work Experience: McKinsey & Company Biography: Prior to HBS, Dina spent four years in McKinsey New York’s healthcare practice, where she was promoted directly from Business Analyst to Engagement Manager.

results.title: [PDF] 47th Annual Rural Health Conference
results.content: 1:30 – 5:00 p.m. Student Track Session/Student Constituency Group Meeting Endymion/Mid City, 8th floor 2:30 – 3:45 p.m. Concurrent Sessions 2A Perspectives on Rural Health Care Quality: Equity & Collaboration Grand Ballroom D, 5th floor Mindy Cook, BSN, RN, National Senior Director, Rural Health Care Quality, American Heart Association Tim Putnam Faculty at The Medical University of South Carolina, Past President NRHA, Past CEO Margaret Mary Health, Co-author Healthcare Leadership and Rural Communities: Challenges, Strategies, and Solutions Kathy Griffis, Chief Nursing Office/VP of Clinical Operations at Titus Regional Medical Center Whitney Ochoa MPH, BSN, RN State STEMI Nurse Coordinator Office of Preparedness & Emergency Response Systems (OPERS) Arkansas Department of Health Eduardo Sanchez, MD, MPH, FAHA, American Heart Association, Chief Medical Officer of Prevention A moderated panel presentation that will bring together rural thought leaders from a variety of setting and roles to engage in a dynamic and diverse conversation addressing the unique opportunities and challenges to providing evidence-based acute care aimed at attaining optimal cardiovascular and stroke outcomes across rural America.
